Articles.Content:
Hi guys, i've just recently started getting some orbital debris around Kerbin, and thought i'd go clean up.

I ran out of fuel while trying to land, so the orbit of my target is about 104x268 km.

I can match the orbital eccentricity without too much difficulty, but I am having trouble moving my ap and pe to match the vessel. Behold!

[ATTACH=CONFIG]33715[/ATTACH]

the [ap] is the same, but about 10 degrees west of what I need.

I tried changing the orbit from where I needed the nodes to be, but it 'undid' all my good work when putting it back to the correct orbit.

halp?
You need to thrust radially (toward or away from the planet) to swing your AP around.

RoboRay's suggestion is good, but you can avoid having to make many such adjustments (and save a lot of fuel) if you start from a circular orbit then bump up/down as appropriate when you pass your target's Pe or Ap.

In your case, I would start with either 104 km or 268 km circular orbit, depending on whether I want to speed up or slow down to rendezvous. I would then bump my orbit up or down as needed at the instant I passed my target's Pe or Ap.
Burn towards a planet at your Pe if you are rotating anticlockwise, or opposite direction if clockwise
